intro: Podandrogyne nutibarana, commonly known as the Malabar nut tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, round fruits that enclose a single, hard-shelled seed. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
